details.title: Transient analysis of a repairable system, using phase-type distributions and geometric processes

authors.affiliation: Fac. de Ciencias, Granada Univ., Spain

p: Rafael Pérez-Ocón is a Professor of Statistics and Probabilities in the Department of Statistics and Operational Research at the University of Granada, Spain. He has taught in applied probability since 1988. He has researched in reliability theory and survival analysis, and has published papers in these fields. His current research interest includes the application of probability & statistical theory to engineering and management problems, maintenance and reliability of complex systems, and studies arising in medical statistics.

authors.name: Rafael Perez-Ocon

p: Delia Montoro-Cazorla is an Assistant Professor in the Industrial Engineereing School of Linares (Jaén), Spain. She has taught and researched in applied probability and reliability theory since 1999. Her interest is in the theory and application of reliability and performance analysis of stochastic systems. At the present, she is focused on the Markov modeling of complex systems and on the performance of computational programmes for analyzing stochastic reliability systems.

details.abstract: The transient behavior of a system with operational and repair times distributed following phase-type distributions is studied. These times are alternated in the evolution of the system, and they form 2 separate geometric processes. The stationary study of this system when the repair times form a renewal process has been made . This paper also considers that operational times are partitioned into two well-distinguished classes successively occupied: good, and preventive. An algorithmic approach is performed to determine the transition probabilities for the Markov process which governs the system, and other performance measures beyond those in are calculated in a well-structured form. The results are applied to a numerical example, and the transient quantities are compared with the ones obtained in the stationary case. The computational implementation of the mathematical expressions formulated are performed using the Matlab program.

references.title: Repairable models with operating and repair times governed by phase type distributions

context.text: Later, [3] considered a system in steady-state with phase-type distributed operational and repair times.
This paper considers the system in [3].
The generator \${\bf Q}\$ of this Markov process has been constructed by [3] in the case \$b=1\$.
The expression of the stationary distribution is an extension for \$b\ne 1\$ of the one in [3].
A numerical approach to the steady state is also considered by using expressions in [3].

links.abstract: A system of N statistically identical machines is modeled using renewal theory through a unique architecture and state space. The model is very useful in evaluating flexible manufacturing systems (FMS) in particular. Each machine consists of multiple part types that are subject to individual failure. A multiple stage repair process composed of integrable sojourn time distributions requires access to spare parts to repair down machines.
